Key Arguments: The legislation will harm Australians by silencing them.
The government should protect individual rights, not suppress them.
The government's past attempts to define misinformation, particularly during the pandemic, were flawed.
Censorship during the pandemic was misguided as the government's stance on Covid-19 vaccines was proven incorrect.
Notable Quotes: The Commonwealth is responsible for protecting the rights of the individual, not suppressing them.
The recent history of the government attempting to define what is 'misinformation' should cause grave concerns about this bill.
This one example shows why giving the government even more power is a recipe for disaster.
